edu.wctc.wad.date

Class DateUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wctc.wad.date.DateUtilities

  • public class DateUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to manage frequently used Date and Time code using Java version 1.8 API

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DateUtilities()

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long findDifferenceInDays(java.time.LocalDateTime start, java.time.LocalDateTime end)
      Returns the difference between two LocalDateTime objects as DAYS stored as a long
      long findDifferenceInHours(java.time.LocalDateTime start, java.time.LocalDateTime end)
      Returns the difference between two LocalDateTime objects as HOURS stored as a long
      long findDifferenceInMinutes(java.time.LocalDateTime start, java.time.LocalDateTime end)
      Returns the difference between two LocalDateTime objects as MINUTES stored as a long
      java.lang.String getDateXAmountOfMonthsInFuture(long monthsInFuture)
      Formats a date to a String while giving the user the option to choose the amount of MONTHS in the future they want the date (in String format) returned to be
      java.lang.String getFormattedDateXAmountOfDaysInFuture(long daysInFuture)
      Formats a date to a String while giving the user the option to choose the amount of DAYS in the future they want the date (in String format) returned to be
      java.lang.String getFormattedDateXAmountOfDaysInPast(long daysInPast)
      Formats a date to a String X DAYS in the past (where X is the long "daysInPast")
      java.lang.String getFormattedDateXAmountOfMonthsInPast(long monthsInPast)
      Formats a date to a String X MONTHS in the past (where X is the long "monthsInPast")
      java.lang.String localDateTimeToString(java.time.LocalDateTime dateTime)
      Formats a LocalDateTime object to a String with the format "yyyy-MM-dd"
      java.time.LocalDateTime stringToLocalDateTime(java.lang.String stringToFormatToDate)
      Parses a user String with the format "yyyy-MM-dd" into a LocalDateTime object

    • Method Detail

      • stringToLocalDateTime

        public java.time.LocalDateTime stringToLocalDateTime(java.lang.String stringToFormatToDate)
        Parses a user String with the format "yyyy-MM-dd" into a LocalDateTime object
        Parameters:
        stringToFormatToDate - - a String that will be parsed into a LocalDateTime object. String must be in the format "yyyy-MM-dd"
        Returns:
        a LocalDateTime object with the date and time parsed from the String value that is entered by user

      • localDateTimeToString

        public java.lang.String localDateTimeToString(java.time.LocalDateTime dateTime)
        Formats a LocalDateTime object to a String with the format "yyyy-MM-dd"
        Parameters:
        dateTime - - a LocalDateTime object
        Returns:
        - a String that is formatted into pattern "yyyy-MM-dd" from a LocalDateTime object

      • findDifferenceInDays

        public long findDifferenceInDays(java.time.LocalDateTime start,
                                 java.time.LocalDateTime end)
        Returns the difference between two LocalDateTime objects as DAYS stored as a long
        Parameters:
        start - - a LocalDateTime object
        end - - a LocalDateTime object
        Returns:
        - the difference in Days as a long between two LocalDateTime objects

      • getFormattedDateXAmountOfDaysInFuture

        public java.lang.String getFormattedDateXAmountOfDaysInFuture(long daysInFuture)
        Formats a date to a String while giving the user the option to choose the amount of DAYS in the future they want the date (in String format) returned to be
        Parameters:
        daysInFuture - - a Long chosen by user to specify the amount of days ahead that they want the returned date (in String format) to be
        Returns:
        - a String formatted from a LocalDateTime

      • getDateXAmountOfMonthsInFuture

        public java.lang.String getDateXAmountOfMonthsInFuture(long monthsInFuture)
        Formats a date to a String while giving the user the option to choose the amount of MONTHS in the future they want the date (in String format) returned to be
        Parameters:
        monthsInFuture - - a Long chosen by user to specify amount of MONTHS ahead that they want the returned date (in String format) to be
        Returns:
        - a String formatted from a LocalDateTime

      • getFormattedDateXAmountOfDaysInPast

        public java.lang.String getFormattedDateXAmountOfDaysInPast(long daysInPast)
        Formats a date to a String X DAYS in the past (where X is the long "daysInPast")
        Parameters:
        daysInPast - - a Long chosen by user to specify amount of DAYS in the PAST that user wants the returned date (in String format) to be
        Returns:
        - a String formatted from a LocalDateTime

      • getFormattedDateXAmountOfMonthsInPast

        public java.lang.String getFormattedDateXAmountOfMonthsInPast(long monthsInPast)
        Formats a date to a String X MONTHS in the past (where X is the long "monthsInPast")
        Parameters:
        monthsInPast - - a Long chosen by user to specify amount of MONTHS in PAST that user wants the returned date (in String format) to be
        Returns:
        - a String formatted from a LocalDateTime
